intro: Erysimum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Erysimum hirsutum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
